subject: Sales
title: Buyer's Remorse Explained
description: A micro-lesson that makes Buyer's Remorse Explained usable.

hook.text: You buy a car and feel great for ten minutes. Then dread hits: did I pay too much? Wrong color?

buildup.text: Buyer's remorse is post-purchase regret driven by dissonance between the action and lingering doubt.

discovery.text: The bigger the purchase, the stronger the remorse. The brain second-guesses proportional to the stakes.

twist.text: Smart sellers prevent remorse before it starts. Post-sale reassurance cuts cancellation rates sharply.

climax.text: Send a confirmation note. Celebrate the choice. Reinforce why they made exactly the right decision.

punchline.text: The sale doesn't end at yes. It ends at certainty.

quiz.question: What causes buyer's remorse?
options: Cognitive dissonance between the purchase and lingering doubt
